arabicText: إِنَّمَآ إِلَـٰهُكُمُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ عِلْمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“Your	God	is	only	Allah - other	than	for	Whom	there	is	no	worship;	His	knowledge	encompasses	
all	things.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tumhāra	m'abood	to	wohi	Allah	hai	jiske	siwa	kisi	ki	bandagi	nahiñ	har	cheez	ko	uska	Ílm	muheeṭ
hai.

arabicText: كَذَٰلِكَ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ مِنْ أَنۢبَآءِ مَا قَدْ سَبَقَ ۚ وَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَـٰكَ مِن لَّدُنَّا ذِكْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
This	is	how	We	relate	the	former	tidings	
to	 you	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	 Muhammad -
peace	 and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him);	 and	
We	 have	 given	 you	 a	 Remembrance	 *	
from	Ourselves.	(*The Holy Qur’an.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ham	aisa	hi	Tumhāre	sāmne	agli	khabreñ	
bayān	 farmāte	 haiñ	 aur	 ham	 ne	 tum	 ko	
apne	pās	se	ek	ẓikr	‘aṭa		farmāya.

arabicText: مَّنْ أَعْرَضَ عَنْهُ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَحْمِلُ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ وِزْرًا
englishTranslationText:
Whoever	turns	away	from	it,	will	bear	a	
burden	on	the	Day	of	Resurrection.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	 us	 se	 muñh	 phere	 to	 be-shak	 	 woh	
Qayāmat	ke	din	ek	bojh	uthāyega.

arabicText: خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهِ ۖ وَسَآءَ لَهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ حِمْلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
They	will	remain	in	it	 forever	- what	an	
evil	 burden	 it	 will	 be	 for	 them	 on	 the	
Day	of	Resurrection!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	hameshā	us	meiñ	raheñ	ge	.	aur	woh	
qayāmat	 ke	 din	 unke	 haq	 meiñ	 kya	 hi	
bura	bojh	hoga.

arabicText: يَوْمَ يُنفَخُ فِى ٱلصُّورِ ۚ وَنَحْشُرُ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ زُرْقًۭا
englishTranslationText:
On	 the	 day	when	 the	Trumpet	is	 blown	
and	We	shall	assemble	the	guilty	on	that	
day,	blue	-eyed.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	din	Soor phuñka	jāye	ga		aur	ham	us	
din	 mujrimoñ	 ko	 uthāyeñge	 neeli	
āañkheñ.

arabicText: يَتَخَـٰفَتُونَ بَيْنَهُمْ إِن لَّبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا عَشْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Whispering	 secretly	 among	 themselves,	
“You	have	not	stayed on	earth	but	for	ten	
days.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Āapas	meiñ	chupke	chupke	kahte	hoñge	
ke	 tum	 duniya	meiñ	 na	 rahe	magar	 das	
rāt.

arabicText: نَّحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ إِذْ يَقُولُ أَمْثَلُهُمْ طَرِيقَةً إِن لَّبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا يَوْمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
We	 know	 well	 what	 they	 will	 utter,	
whereas	 the	 wisest	 among	 them	 will	
say,	“You	have	stayed	just	for	a	day.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ham	 khoob	jānte	 haiñ	jo	woh	 kaheñ	 ge	
jab	 ke	 un	meiñ	 sab	 se	 behtar	 rāye	wāla	
kahega	ke	tum	sirf	ek	hi	din	rahe	they	.

arabicText: وَيَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلْجِبَالِ فَقُلْ يَنسِفُهَا رَبِّى نَسْفًۭا
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 tum	 se	 pahādoñ	 ko	 poochhte	 haiñ	
tum	 farmāo	 unheñ	 mera	 Rab reza	 reza	
kar	ke	uda	dega

arabicText: فَيَذَرُهَا قَاعًۭا صَفْصَفًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“Therefore	 leaving	 the	 earth	 just	 as	 an	
empty	plain.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. To	 zameen	 ko	 pat	 par	 hamwār	 kar	
chhodega.

arabicText: لَّا تَرَىٰ فِيهَا عِوَجًۭا وَلَآ أَمْتًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“In	which	 you	 shall	 neither	 see	 ups	 nor	
downs.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ke	 tu	 us	meiñ	 neecha	 ooñcha	 kuchh	 na	
dekhe

arabicText: يَوْمَئِذٍۢ يَتَّبِعُونَ ٱلدَّاعِىَ لَا عِوَجَ لَهُۥ ۖ وَخَشَعَتِ ٱلْأَصْوَاتُ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ فَلَا تَسْمَعُ إِلَّا هَمْسًۭا
englishTranslationText:
On	 that	 day	 they	 will	 run	 after	 a	 caller,	
there	 will	 be	 no	 deviation	 in	 it;	 and	
voices	 shall	 become	 hushed	 before	 the	 Most	 Gracious,	 so	 you	 will	 not	 hear	 except	 a	 faint	
sound.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	 din	 pukārne	wāle	 ke	 peeche	 daudeñ	
ge	us	meiñ	kaji	na	hogi	aur	sab	āawāzeñ	Rahmān	huzoor	past	ho	kar	rah	jāyeñgi	to	tu	na	sunega	
magar	bahut	āahista	āawāz.

arabicText: يَوْمَئِذٍۢ لَّا تَنفَعُ ٱلشَّفَـٰعَةُ إِلَّا مَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ وَرَضِىَ لَهُۥ قَوْلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
On	 that	day	no	one’s	intercession	shall	benefit	except	his	 to	whom	 the	Most	Gracious	has	given	
permission	and	whose	word	He	has	liked.	(The Holy Prophets and virtuous people will be given 
the permission to intercede. Prophet Muhammad - peace and blessings be upon him - will be 
the first to intercede.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Us	din	kisi	ki	shafā'at	kām	na	degi	magar	us	ki	jise	Rahmān	ne	izn	de	diya	hai	aur	us	ki	bāt	
pasand	farmāyi		.

arabicText: يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِهِۦ عِلْمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
. He	 knows	 all	 that	is	 before	 them	 and	 all	 that	is	 behind	 them,	 whereas	 their	 knowledge	 cannot	
encompass	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jānta	hai	jo	kuchh	un	ke	āage		hai	aur	jo	kuchh	un	ke	peechhe	aur	un	ka	'ilm	usey	nahiñ	
gher	sakta.

arabicText: ۞ وَعَنَتِ ٱلْوُجُوهُ لِلْحَىِّ ٱلْقَيُّومِ ۖ وَقَدْ خَابَ مَنْ حَمَلَ ظُلْمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	all	faces	shall	bow	before	the	Living,	the	All	Sustaining;	and	the	one	who	bore	the	burden	of	
injustice,	has	failed.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	sab	muñh	jhuk	jāyeñge	us	zindah	qāyim	rakhne	wāle	ke	huzoor	aur	be-shak na-murād	raha	
jis	ne	ẓulm	ka	bojh	liya.

arabicText: وَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌۭ فَلَا يَخَافُ ظُلْمًۭا وَلَا هَضْمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	the	one	who	does	some	good	deeds,	and	is	a	Muslim	- he	shall	have	no	fear	of	injustice,	nor	
suffer	any	loss.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jo	kuchh	nek	kām	kare	aur	ho	Musalmān	to	usey	na	ziyadti	ka	khouf	hoga	na	nuqsān	ka.

arabicText: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ قُرْءَانًا عَرَبِيًّۭا وَصَرَّفْنَا فِيهِ مِنَ ٱلْوَعِيدِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَّقُونَ أَوْ يُحْدِثُ لَهُمْ ذِكْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	this	is	how	We	revealed	it	as	an	Arabic	Qur’an,	and	in	different	ways	gave	promises	of	
punishment,	that	they	may	fear	or	it	may	create	some	pondering	in	their	hearts.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yooñ	hi	ham	ne	isey	Arabi	Qurān	utāra	aur	is	meiñ	ṭarah	ṭarah	se	'azāb	ke	w'ade	diye	ke	
kahiñ	unheñ	kuchh	dar	ho	yā	in	ke	dil	meiñ	kuchh	soñch	paida	kare.

arabicText: فَتَعَـٰلَى ٱللَّهُ ٱلْمَلِكُ ٱلْحَقُّ ۗ وَلَا تَعْجَلْ بِٱلْقُرْءَانِ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يُقْضَىٰٓ إِلَيْكَ وَحْيُهُۥ ۖ وَقُل رَّبِّ زِدْنِى عِلْمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	 Supreme	 is	 Allah,	 the	 True	
King;	and	do	not	hasten	in	 the	Qur’an	(O	
dear	 Prophet	 Muhammad - peace	 and	
blessings	 be	 upon	 him)	 until	 its	 divine	
revelation	 has	 been	 completed	 to	 you;	
and	 pray,	 “My	 Lord,	 bestow	 me	 more	
knowledge.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 sab	 se	 buland	 hai	 Allah sachcha	
Bādshah	aur	Qurān	meiñ	jaldi	na	karo	jab	
tak	uski	waḥi	tumheñ	puri	na	ho	le	aur	'arz	
karo	 ke	 aey	mere	Rab mujhe	 'ilm	 ziyāda	
de.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ عَهِدْنَآ إِلَىٰٓ ءَادَمَ مِن قَبْلُ فَنَسِىَ وَلَمْ نَجِدْ لَهُۥ عَزْمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 indeed	 before	 this	 We	 made	 a	
covenant	 with	 Adam,	 so	 he	 forgot,	 and	
We	did	not	find	its	intention	(in	him).
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	be-shak	Ham	ne	Ādam ko	is	se	pehle	
ek	 tā-keedi	 hukm	 diya	 tha	 to	 woh	 bhool	
gayā	aur	Ham	ne	us	ka	qasad	na	pāya	.

arabicText: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ ٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِـَٔادَمَ فَسَجَدُوٓا۟ إِلَّآ إِبْلِيسَ أَبَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
And	 when	 We	 commanded	 the	 angels,	
“Prostrate	 before	 Adam”	 - so	 they	 all	
prostrated,	except	Iblis;	he	refused.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	jab	Ham	 ne	Farishtoñ	 se	 farmāya	 ke	
Ādam ko	sajdah	karo	to		sab	sajdeh	meiñ	
gire	magar	iblees	us	ne	nā	māna..

arabicText: فَقُلْنَا يَـٰٓـَٔادَمُ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا عَدُوٌّۭ لَّكَ وَلِزَوْجِكَ فَلَا يُخْرِجَنَّكُمَا مِنَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ فَتَشْقَىٰٓ
englishTranslationText:
We	 therefore	 said,	 “O	 Adam,	 he	 is	 your	
and	your	wife’s	enemy,	so	may	he	not	get	
you	 both	 out	 from	 heaven,	 so	 you	 then	
fall	into	hardship.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 Ham	 ne	 farmāya	 aey	 Ādam	 be-shak		
yeh tera	aur	 teri	biwi	ka	dushman	hai	 to	
aisa	na	ho	ke	tum	donoñ	ko	Jannat	se	nikāl	
de	phir	tu	mashaqqat	meiñ	pade.

arabicText: إِنَّ لَكَ أَلَّا تَجُوعَ فِيهَا وَلَا تَعْرَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
. “Indeed	for	you	in	heaven	is	that	you	may	
never	be	hungry	nor	be	unclothed.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	tere	liye Jannat	meiñ	yeh	hai	ke	na	
tu	bhooka	ho	na	nañga	ho.

arabicText: وَأَنَّكَ لَا تَظْمَؤُا۟ فِيهَا وَلَا تَضْحَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
“And	 that	 you	 never	 feel	 thirsty	 nor	 hot	
sunshine	hurt	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yeh		ke	tujhe	na	us	meiñ	piyās	lage	na	
dhoop.

arabicText: فَوَسْوَسَ إِلَيْهِ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ قَالَ يَـٰٓـَٔادَمُ هَلْ أَدُلُّكَ عَلَىٰ شَجَرَةِ ٱلْخُلْدِ وَمُلْكٍۢ لَّا يَبْلَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
So	the	devil	incited	him,	saying,	“O	Adam,	
shall	 I	 show	 you	 the	 tree	 of	 immortality	
and	a	kingdom	that	does	not	erode?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	shaitān	ne	usey	waswasa	diya	bola	aey	
Ādam!	 Kya	 maiñ	 tumheñ	 bata	 duñ	
hamesha	jeene	 ka	ped	aur	woh	bādshāhi	
ke	purāni	na	pade.

arabicText: فَأَكَلَا مِنْهَا فَبَدَتْ لَهُمَا سَوْءَٰتُهُمَا وَطَفِقَا يَخْصِفَانِ عَلَيْهِمَا مِن وَرَقِ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ۚ وَعَصَىٰٓ ءَادَمُ رَبَّهُۥ فَغَوَىٰ
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	un	donoñ	ne	us	meiñ	se	kha	liya	ab	un	
par	unki	sharam	ki	cheezeñ	ẓāhir	huyiñ	aur	jannat	me	patte	apne	ūpar	chipkāne	lage	aur	Ādam
se	apne	Rab ke	hukm	meiñ	laghzish	waqe’	huyi	to	jo	matlab	chāha	tha	uski	rāh	na	pāyi.

arabicText: ثُمَّ ٱجْتَبَـٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَتَابَ عَلَيْهِ وَهَدَىٰ
englishTranslationText: Then	his	Lord	chose	him,	and	inclined	towards	him	with	His	mercy,	and	guided	him.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	usey	us	ke	Rab	ne	chun	liya	to	us	par	apni	Rahmat	se	ruju'	farmāyi	aur	apne	Qurb-e-Khās	ki	
rāh	dikhāyi.

arabicText: قَالَ ٱهْبِطَا مِنْهَا جَمِيعًۢا ۖ بَعْضُكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ عَدُوٌّۭ ۖ فَإِمَّا يَأْتِيَنَّكُم مِّنِّى هُدًۭى فَمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَ هُدَاىَ فَلَا يَضِلُّ وَلَا يَشْقَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	 “Both of	 you	go	down	 from	heaven,	 one	 of	 you	is	an	enemy	 to	 the	 other;	 then	if	 the	
guidance	from	Me	comes	to	you	- then	whoever	follows	My	guidance,	will	not	go	astray	nor	be	
ill-fated.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Farmāya	ke	tum	donoñ	mil	kar	Jannat	se	utro	tum	meiñ	ek	doosre	ka	dushman	hai	phir	agar	tum	
sab	ko	meri	ṭaraf	se	hidāyat	āaye	to	jo	meri	hidāyat	ka	pairo	huwa	woh	na	bahke	na	bad	bakht	
ho.

arabicText: وَمَنْ أَعْرَضَ عَن ذِكْرِى فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ مَعِيشَةًۭ ضَنكًۭا وَنَحْشُرُهُۥ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ أَعْمَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
“And	the	one	who	turned	away	from	My	remembrance	- for	him	is	a	confined	existence,	and	We	
shall	raise	him	blind	on	the	Day	of	Resurrection.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jisne	meri	yād	se	muñh	phera	to	be-shak us	ke	liye	tang	zindagāni	hai	aur	Ham	usey	Qayāmat	
ke	din	andha	uthāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ لِمَ حَشَرْتَنِىٓ أَعْمَىٰ وَقَدْ كُنتُ بَصِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText: He	will	say,	“O	my	Lord,	why	have	You	raised	me	blind,	whereas	I	was	sighted?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Kahega	aey	Rab	 mere!	Mujhe	tu	ne	kyuñ	andha	uthāya	meiñ	to	ankhiyāra	(dekhne	wāla)	tha?

arabicText: قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ أَتَتْكَ ءَايَـٰتُنَا فَنَسِيتَهَا ۖ وَكَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمَ تُنسَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
He	will	say,	“Similarly	did	Our	signs	come	to	
you	 but	 you	 forgot	 them;	 and in	 the	 same	
way,	nobody	will	heed	you	today.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Farmāyega	yooñ	hi	tere	pās	Hamāri	Āyateñ	
āayi	thiñ	tune	unheñ	bhula	diya	aur	aise	hi	
āaj		teri	koi	khabar	na	lega.

arabicText: وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى مَنْ أَسْرَفَ وَلَمْ يُؤْمِنۢ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِۦ ۚ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَشَدُّ وَأَبْقَىٰٓ
englishTranslationText:
And	 this	 is	 how	 We	 reward	 him	 who	
transgresses	and	does	not	accept	 faith	in	
the	 signs	 of	 his	 Lord;	 and	 indeed	 the	
punishment	 of	 the	 Hereafter	 is	 the	 most	
severe	and	more	lasting.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	aisa	 hi	 badla	 dete	 haiñ	jo	 had	 se	
badhe	aur	apne	Rab ki	Āyatoñ	par	Imān na	
lāye	 aur	 be-shak	 āakhirat	 ka	 'aƶāb	 sabse	
sakht	tar	aur	sabse	der	pā	hai.

arabicText: أَفَلَمْ يَهْدِ لَهُمْ كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّنَ ٱلْقُرُونِ يَمْشُونَ فِى مَسَـٰكِنِهِمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّأُو۟لِى ٱلنُّهَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
So	 did	 they	 not	 gain	 guidance	 from	
(knowing)	 how	 many	 generations	 We	
have	 destroyed	 before	 them,	 among	
whose	 dwellings	 they	 walk?	 Indeed	 in	 it	
are	signs	for	men	of	intellect.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kya	inheñ	is	se	rāh	na	mili	ke	ham	ne	un	
se	 pahle	 kitni	 sangtateñ	 (Qoumeiñ)	 halāk	
kar	diñ	ke	yeh	un	ke	basne	ki	jagah	chalte	
phirte	haiñ	be-shak	is	meiñ	nishāniyañ	haiñ	
'aqal	waloñ	ko.

arabicText: وَلَوْلَا كَلِمَةٌۭ سَبَقَتْ مِن رَّبِّكَ لَكَانَ لِزَامًۭا وَأَجَلٌۭ مُّسَمًّۭى
englishTranslationText:
And	 had	 not	 a	 command	 of	 your	 Lord	
been	passed,	then	the	punishment	would	
have	 gripped	 them	- and	 had	 a	 term	 not	
been	appointed.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 agar	 tumhāre	 Rab ki	 ek	 bāt	 na	 guzar	
chuki	 hoti	 to	 zaroor	 'aƶāb	 unheñ	lipat	jāta	
aur	agar	na	hota	ek	w'ada	thehrāya	huwa.

arabicText: فَٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ ٱلشَّمْسِ وَقَبْلَ غُرُوبِهَا ۖ وَمِنْ ءَانَآئِ ٱلَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْ وَأَطْرَافَ ٱلنَّهَارِ لَعَلَّكَ تَرْضَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	 Muhammad -
peace	 and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him),	
patiently	 forbear	 upon	 their	 speech,	 and	
praising	 your	 Lord	 proclaim	 His	 Purity,	
before	 the	 sun	 rises	 and	 before	 it	 sets;	
and	proclaim	His	Purity	at	some	times	of
the	night	and	at	 the	 two	ends	of	 the	day,	
in	 the	 hope	 that	 you	 be	 pleased.	 (*With 
the great reward from your Lord)
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	un	ki	bātoñ	par	sabr	karo	aur	apne	Rab	
ko	sarāhte		 (t'areef	karte)	huwe	us	ki	pāki	
bolo	 sooraj	 chamakne	 se	 pahle	 aur	 us	 ke	
doobne	 se	 pahle	 aur	 rāt	 ki	 ghādiyoñ	meiñ	
uski	 pāki	 bolo	 aur	 din	 ke	 kināroñ	 par	 us	
ummid	par	ke	tum	rāzi	ho

arabicText: وَلَا تَمُدَّنَّ عَيْنَيْكَ إِلَىٰ مَا مَتَّعْنَا بِهِۦٓ أَزْوَٰجًۭا مِّنْهُمْ زَهْرَةَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا لِنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِ ۚ وَرِزْقُ رَبِّكَ خَيْرٌۭ وَأَبْقَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
And	 O	 listener,	 do	 not	 extend	 your	 eyes	
towards	 what	 We	 have	 given	 to	
disbelieving	couples	to	enjoy	- the	bloom	
of	 the	 worldly	life	- so	 that	We	may	 test	
them	with	it;	and	 the	sustenance	of	 your	
Lord	is	the	best,	and	more	lasting.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	aey	sunne	wāle!	Apni	āañkheñ	na	phaila	
uski	 ṭaraf	 jo	 hamne	 kāfiroñ	 ke	 jodoñ	 ko	
baratne	ke	liye	di	hai	jitni	duniya	ki	tāzgi	ke	
ham	unheñ	us ke	sabab	fitne	meiñ	daleñ	aur	
tere	Rab ka	rizq	sab	se	achchha	aur	sab	se	
der	pā	hai.

arabicText: وَأْمُرْ أَهْلَكَ بِٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَٱصْطَبِرْ عَلَيْهَا ۖ لَا نَسْـَٔلُكَ رِزْقًۭا ۖ نَّحْنُ نَرْزُقُكَ ۗ وَٱلْعَـٰقِبَةُ لِلتَّقْوَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
And	command	your	household	 to	establish	prayer,	and	yourself	be	steadfast	in	it;	We	do	not	ask	
any	sustenance	from	you;	We	will	provide	you	sustenance;	and	the	excellent	result	is	for	piety.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	apne	ghar	wāloñ	ko	Namāz ka	hukm	de	
aur	khud	us	par	ṣābit	rah	kuchh	ham	tujh	se	
rozi	nahiñ	mañgte	ham	tujhe	rozi	deñ	ge	aur	anjām	ka	bhalā	parhezgāri	ke	liye	.

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ لَوْلَا يَأْتِينَا بِـَٔايَةٍۢ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦٓ ۚ أَوَلَمْ تَأْتِهِم بَيِّنَةُ مَا فِى ٱلصُّحُفِ ٱلْأُولَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
And	 the	 disbelievers	 said,	 “Why	 does	 he	 not	 bring	 to	 us	 a	 sign	 from	 his	 Lord?”;	 did	 not	 the	
explanation	of	what	is	in	the	former	Books,	come	to	them?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kāfir	bole	yeh	apne	Rab ke	pās	se	koi	nishāni	kyuñ	nahiñ	lāte	aur	kya	unheñ	is	ka	bayān	na	āaya		
jo	agle	sahifoñ	meiñ	hai.

arabicText: وَلَوْ أَنَّآ أَهْلَكْنَـٰهُم بِعَذَابٍۢ مِّن قَبْلِهِۦ لَقَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَا لَوْلَآ أَرْسَلْتَ إِلَيْنَا رَسُولًۭا فَنَتَّبِعَ ءَايَـٰتِكَ مِن قَبْلِ أَن نَّذِلَّ وَنَخْزَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
And	had	We	destroyed	them	with	some	punishment	before	the	advent	of	a	Noble	Messenger,	they	
would	have	certainly	said,	“Our	Lord,	why	did	You	not	send	a	Noble	Messenger	to	us,	so	we	would	
have	followed	Your	signs,	before	being	humiliated	and	disgraced?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	ham	unheñ	kisi	ázāb	se	halāk	kar	dete	Rasool ke	āane	se	pahle	to	zaroor	kahte	aey	hamāre	
Rab toonay hamāri	ṭaraf	koi	Rasool kyuñ	na	bheja	ke	ham	teri	āayatoñ	par	chalte	qabl	iske	ke	ƶaleel	
wa	ruswa	hote.

arabicText: قُلْ كُلٌّۭ مُّتَرَبِّصٌۭ فَتَرَبَّصُوا۟ ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلصِّرَٰطِ ٱلسَّوِىِّ وَمَنِ ٱهْتَدَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	 “Each	 one	 is	 waiting;	 so	 you	 too	 wait;	 very	 soon	 you	 will	 come	 to	 know	 who	 are	 the	
people	of	the	right	path,	and	who	has	attained	guidance.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	sab	rāh	dekh	rahe	haiñ	to	tum	bhi	rāh	dekho	to	ab	jān	jāoge	ki kaun	haiñ	seedhi	rāh	wāle	
aur	kis	ne	hidāyat	pāyi.
